comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The picture shows the Pacific Hawk a six-place, enclosed, twin motored biplane designed by O.W. Timm, engineer for the Pacific Airplane & Supply Co. to meet the demand for a small low priced pleasure or commercial ship of the twin-motored type. Date 1920. More information is in the USA magazine Aviation August 15, 1920 pages 47-48
